title_en: AI-Augmented Pollen Recognition in Optical and Holographic Microscopy for Veterinary Imaging
title_zh: 面向兽医影像的光学与全息显微镜中人工智能增强的花粉识别研究
summary_en: We present a comprehensive study on fully automated pollen recognition across both conventional optical and digital in-line holographic microscopy (DIHM) images of sample slides. Visually recognizing pollen in unreconstructed holographic images remains challenging due to speckle noise, twin-image artifacts and substantial divergence from bright-field appearances. We establish the performance baseline by training YOLOv8s for object detection and MobileNetV3L for classification on a dual-modality dataset of automatically annotated optical and affinely aligned DIHM images. On optical data, detection mAP50 reaches 91.3% and classification accuracy reaches 97%, whereas on DIHM data, we achieve only 8.15% for detection mAP50 and 50% for classification accuracy. Expanding the bounding boxes of pollens in DIHM images over those acquired in aligned optical images achieves 13.3% for detection mAP50 and 54% for classification accuracy. To improve object detection in DIHM images, we employ a Wasserstein GAN with spectral normalization (WGAN-SN) to create synthetic DIHM images, yielding an FID score of 58.246. Mixing real-world and synthetic data at the 1.0 : 1.5 ratio for DIHM images improves object detection up to 15.4%. These results demonstrate that GAN-based augmentation can reduce the performance divide, bringing fully automated DIHM workflows for veterinary imaging a small but important step closer to practice.
summary_zh: 本研究针对样本玻片的传统光学显微镜图像与数字同轴全息显微镜（DIHM）图像，开展了全自动花粉识别的综合性研究。由于散斑噪声、孪生像伪影以及与明场图像的表观显著差异，在未重建的全息图像中进行视觉花粉识别仍具挑战性。我们通过在一个自动标注的光学图像与仿射对齐的DIHM图像双模态数据集上，训练YOLOv8s进行目标检测、MobileNetV3L进行分类，建立了性能基线。在光学数据上，检测mAP50达到91.3%，分类准确率达到97%；而在DIHM数据上，检测mAP50仅为8.15%，分类准确率为50%。将DIHM图像中花粉的边界框相对于对齐的光学图像中获取的边界框进行扩展后，检测mAP50提升至13.3%，分类准确率提升至54%。为改善DIHM图像中的目标检测，我们采用带谱归一化的Wasserstein生成对抗网络（WGAN-SN）生成合成DIHM图像，所得FID分数为58.246。以1.0 : 1.5的比例混合真实与合成的DIHM图像数据，可将目标检测性能提升至15.4%。这些结果表明，基于GAN的数据增强能够缩小性能差距，为兽医影像领域的全自动DIHM工作流程迈向实践迈出了虽小但重要的一步。
